titleStmt.title: The last discourse betwixt Master Abel and Master Richard Kilvert, interrupted at the first by an ancient and angry gentlewoman, who being her selfe unknowne unto the observer of this conference, it was conceived by him afterwards to be a certaine friend of Mr Abels.
titleStmt.author: Abell, William, fl. 1640.

notesStmt.note: A satire against Richard Kilvert and William Abel, alderman of London, imprisoned in November 1640 for his "part in the imposition of the arbitrary duty of 40s. per tun on wine." (cf.DNB).
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
